import re
from collections import Counter

def check_word_identicality_and_capitalization(sentence1: str, sentence2: str):
    """"""
    words1 = re.findall('\\b\\w+\\b', sentence1)
    words2 = re.findall('\\b\\w+\\b', sentence2)
    wc1 = Counter(words1)
    wc2 = Counter(words2)
    return wc1 == wc2

import re
from collections import Counter

def check_word_identicality_and_capitalization(sentence1: str, sentence2: str):
    """
    Checks if two input strings have the same set of distinct words, disregarding non-alphabetical characters, 
    but considering their original capitalization.

    Args:
    sentence1 (str): The first input sentence.
    sentence2 (str): The second input sentence.

    Returns:
    bool: True if the two strings meet the condition, False otherwise.
    """
    words1 = re.findall('\\b\\w+\\b', sentence1)
    words2 = re.findall('\\b\\w+\\b', sentence2)
    wc1 = Counter(words1)
    wc2 = Counter(words2)
    return wc1 != wc2

import re
from collections import Counter

def check_word_identicality_and_capitalization(sentence1: str, sentence2: str):
    """
    Checks if two input strings have the same set of distinct words, disregarding non-alphabetical characters, 
    but considering their original capitalization.

    Args:
    sentence1 (str): The first input sentence.
    sentence2 (str): The second input sentence.

    Returns:
    bool: True if the two strings meet the condition, False otherwise.
    """
    words1 = re.findall('', sentence1)
    words2 = re.findall('\\b\\w+\\b', sentence2)
    wc1 = Counter(words1)
    wc2 = Counter(words2)
    return wc1 == wc2

import re
from collections import Counter

def check_word_identicality_and_capitalization(sentence1: str, sentence2: str):
    """
    Checks if two input strings have the same set of distinct words, disregarding non-alphabetical characters, 
    but considering their original capitalization.

    Args:
    sentence1 (str): The first input sentence.
    sentence2 (str): The second input sentence.

    Returns:
    bool: True if the two strings meet the condition, False otherwise.
    """
    words1 = re.findall('\\b\\w+\\b', sentence1)
    words2 = re.findall('', sentence2)
    wc1 = Counter(words1)
    wc2 = Counter(words2)
    return wc1 == wc2
